User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

Hi I am using firefox 7.0.1 and all the websites appear small (both font and images) I am using windows 7 ultimate my screen resolution is at 1920x1080 That is the resoltion optimized for my hp laptop Attached are 2 screenshots of youtube.com in firefox and chrome Note that chrome browser does not have this issue

Can someone please help and shed some light on the issue ? Does firefox have a problem working on a screen with this much resolution ?

fx - http://www.flickr.com/photos/62228750@N00/6215798253/in/photostream chrome - http://www.flickr.com/photos/62228750@N00/6215798555/in/photostream

I know font can be increased by ctrl+, but thats annoying as I have to do it for each site i visit. I tried to reset the zoom level but to no avail. 
NoSquint may work, but I was hoping to bring this bug to the attention of developers so it can be fixed without an addon Even IE renders it correctly But ff is my favorite and I don't want to use anything else 


Actual results:

Font/zoom too small on my screen resolution


Expected results:

It should render like this http://www.flickr.com/photos/62228750@N00/6215798555
comments.author: siddharthchhabra@hotmail.com
